greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Sum of the even divisors of 2n.
comment: Also alternating row sums of A236106. - _Omar E. Pol_, Jan 23 2014
Could also be called the twice sigma function, see first formula. - _Omar E. Pol_, Feb 05 2014
link: Antti Karttunen, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..16384
Index entries for sequences related to sigma(n)
Index entries for sequences related to sums of divisors
example: The even divisors of 12 are 12, 6, 4, 2, which sum to 24, so a(6) = 24.
mathematica: f[n_] := Plus @@ Select[ Divisors[ 2n], EvenQ]; Array[f, 62] (* _Robert G. Wilson v_, Apr 09 2011 *)
program: (PARI) a(n) = sumdiv(2*n, d, !(d%2) * d); \\ _Michel Marcus_, Jan 23 2014
xref: k times sigma(n), k=1..6: A000203, this sequence, A272027, A239050, A274535, A274536.
Cf. A146076, which includes the zeros for odd n.
results.author: _Joseph L. Pe_, Nov 25 2002
